title: Manager, Customer Services
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated individual to join the Global Services business unit as Customer Services Manager. To be successful in this role, you'll have passion and a commitment to delivering excellence to ensure the Company fulfils its objectives and promises to its customers. You'll be required to manage and maintain a high quality and high-level of non-technical customer service.

This role would suit an individual looking for a challenging managerial position in an innovative environment, with the opportunity to establish and lead the customer services team in North America, based in our Singapore office.


The Details...

The main aim of the role will be to lead the customer services teams in the Asia/Pacific Region and deliver excellent customer service, through understanding and satisfying the requirements of the customer and key company stakeholders.

Reporting to the Associate Director of Customer Services based in the UK, this role will be responsible for effectively managing the Singapore and Japan customer service teams.

The individual will be responsible for ensuring a high standard a high standard of customer service is maintained at all times and suggesting improvements to our processes and systems.

                                                                                                           

Responsibilities include:

  • Coaching and developing the team of Customer Service Associates in receiving and resolving customer queries always providing a high level of customer service
  • Managing and supervising the workload of the team allocating team members to optimise service provision and administrator support across the opening hours of the Customer Service Department
  • Ensuring the team has the skills and knowledge to carry out their role effectively, identifying any gaps and training needs and implementing the necessary training to address them, ensuring a consistent approach is maintained across the team
  • Acting as the first point of contact for escalated customer issues and varied internal queries throughout the order to cash process
  • Managing and developing the systems and processes within the department to provide the most effective and efficient service to customers, and to ensure internal processes align with other internal team processes where applicable

 


What We're Looking For...

We'll expect you to have previous relevant commercial (preferably with knowledge of US Government purchasing processes) and be well versed in using CRM systems, ideally Salesforce and e-commerce systems. You'll also have an excellent understanding of Microsoft Office and be able to analyse data. You'll be familiar with a fast-moving and technically complex product range, and able to respond to difficult and pressured situations in a calm and organised manner.

You'll need to demonstrate strong customer focus, commercial awareness, excellent organisational and people management skills as well as a flexible and adaptable approach to problem-solving. You're also a creative thinker with outstanding communication skills, through a variety of media, to effectively influence and engage with the customer and key stakeholders. We'll also expect you to be educated to degree level and able to demonstrate a good standard of general education. Understanding different cultures will be vital in this position, as you will be serving customers throughout the Asia/Pacific Region, as well as managing team members from different countries. Being fluent in English is a requirement for this role, and speaking Japanese, Korean or Mandarin would be desirable.

​Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job

title: Senior Scientist
description:
The Details...

Our sequencing platforms are based around MEMS devices requiring the integration between a sensor array and the underlying ASIC that allows multiple nanopore experiments to be performed in parallel. Reporting to the Associate Director of Chip Integration, the successful candidate will be responsible for providing technical leadership across a range of projects involving this key area of MEMS fabrication. Working collaboratively with other groups both within the company and external parities, you will be responsible for delivering improvements in robustness, scalability and performance to the product platform. 

This is an area of continuing innovation for the company and the technical lead will extend across existing and future product concepts.

Responsibilities include:

  • Technical leadership in MEMS projects across multiple platforms (PromethION, MinION and next generation technologies)
  • Coordinating the outsourcing of fabrication projects with external parties / foundry facilities
  • Regular and timely communication between project team members to achieve optimal outcomes and performance
  • Design adaptions to existing processes for improved device fabrication
  • MEMS microfabrication, processing and characterisation in a cleanroom environment
  • Designing lithographic masks
  • Interfacing MEMS with microfluidics and chemistry of sensing system

What We're Looking For...

You will hold a PhD in Engineering, Physics or Chemistry, or have equivalent experience. A strong background of microfabrication and IC/MEMS packaging technologies in an industrial setting is essential. You’ll have experience working with MEMS devices and understand what it takes to transition projects from a proof of concept through to late development phases. Experience of interfacing MEMS devices with microfluidics and lab-on-a-chip based systems would be an advantage.

We will expect you to be an enthusiastic individual who can work with a high degree of autonomy, have great attention to detail and a creative approach to problem solving. Because of the highly interdisciplinary nature of the role excellent communication skills are crucial.

This role will suit someone with the drive to achieve results and who is motivated to impact a key area of a cutting-edge, fast-paced organisation.

Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.​

title: Bioinformatician
description:
The Details...

The successful candidate will work with others in the Genomic Applications group to interpret sequencing data in a range of biological contexts to answer biological questions and to give best-practice advice to customers and our support teams. The role will involve benchmarking, evaluating and comparing different existing analysis methods to understand the effect these approaches have on the final interpretation of the data. Where there are no established methods yet, the job holder will work with other members of the team to explore how best to answer the biological questions posed and establish suitable analysis workflows. You'll collaborate closely with lab scientists to help with experimental design, to make sure they receive the right data, prepared in the right way and to a sufficiently high standard to perform specific analyses. The job holder will communicate their findings to internal stakeholders and present the group’s work in meetings and webinars.

Other responsibilities include:

  • Working on the development of pipelines for analysis of applications of DNA and direct RNA sequencing using ONT’s nanopore sensing platform. This will cover the full range of existing and new applications
  • Working with laboratory-based Applications scientists in the group to help them plan and refine experiments, to interpret the data generated in the appropriate biological context, and to report the results clearly
  • Interacting with other data analysts and bioinformaticians in the company, to utilise and adapt their tools for analysis
  • Working closely with groups in San Francisco and New York to keep up-to-date with the latest developments and to implement these in Oxford
  • Working as part of a multi-disciplinary team on the whole experimental cycle from sample collection through to high-quality publication or other presentation


​What We're Looking For...

We'll expect you to have practical experience of handling and analysing large next-generation sequencing data sets and working closely with lab scientists to continually refine the experimental and analytical approaches. You'll also have a history of involvement in the whole experimental process, from the initial experimental concept to execution, analysis and presentation results, addressing important biological questions. You have knowledge and experience in bioinformatics and statistics and ideally an understanding of the range and limitations of existing bioinformatics tools.

You're also someone with good communication and interpersonal skills with an enthusiasm for technology. You enjoy discussing and presenting data within the team and with other colleagues. In addition, you can solve problems collaboratively and independently and consider yourself someone with high standards but who is able to prioritise and shift focus onto other projects when required. In addition, you have significant experience with scripting languages, e.g. Python, R etc. You'll have a MSc in a Biological Science or Computer Science with a substantial bioinformatics component (or equivalent experience) and ideally an PhD (or equivalent experience) involving analysis and visualisation of DNA and RNA sequence data.

Additional skills, experience and knowledge in the following areas are also desirable:

  • Experience with NGS data analysis - preferably long reads
  • Experience of successfully performing appropriate bioinformatics sequence analyses for a range of different projects
  • Experience with workflow management systems like snakemake and software development practices, e.g. version control
  • Ability to adapt or modify bioinformatic tools or pipelines to achieve specific outcomes
  • Large general biological knowledge such as molecular biology including the transcriptome, microbiomes, environmental ecosystems, diseases, pathogens etc.
  • Up to date with the latest literature about NGS and analysis
  • Hands-on wet lab experience or a track record of interaction with wet lab scientists
  • Experience with simple sample and library preparation for NGS
  • Knowledge of commercial applications of genomics and long read sequencing

  • Input to strategic plans that advance the development of the chip and flowcell within Nanopore products

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
The Details…..

On site there is extensive provision for rapid functional prototyping and testing. Our mechanical workshop includes mill, lathe, high resolution multi-material 3D printer, pick & place and dispenser robots, a polymer laser welder and CO2 laser cutter. Our development lab includes the latest instrumentation for imaging, sensing, data logging, and running automation systems. 

This exciting and challenging role is responsible for:

  • Creating innovative concepts to address the technical needs of new products
  • Conducting design feasibility studies; detailing assumptions, calculations, analysis, results and conclusions in technical reports to guide product development
  • Designing and developing new product concepts including system level evaluation through to detailed calculation, design, testing and analysis.
  • Supporting and troubleshooting the introduction of new products into pilot production


The engineering department is responsible for the design of instruments, consumables and functional packaging as well as novel manufacturing systems from concept through to automated production. The team includes over 30 engineers, with core strengths in mechanical, fluidic, electronic, firmware, and production engineering. 

Our products have proven uniquely suited to thousands of applications around the world and our production and product range is increasing rapidly in response. We place a strong emphasis on maximising new product function within radically small form factors. We engineer each product from first principles and as a result, nearly all parts are custom designed. 

We maintain strong relationships with quality-focused, local, high tech suppliers for moulding, machining, electronics and other prototyping.  Combined with the capability to build and test any of our products on site, we are able to achieve exceptionally rapid development from concept to production.

What We're Looking For...

We're looking for a Senior Engineer with enthusiasm for problem-solving and good attention to detail plus experience in prototyping and rapid manufacturing technologies.

We'll expect you to be educated to a degree level in Engineering or Physics with extensive experience in precision, high tech, medical or engineering roles with responsibility for new product technical development. If you also have experience with injection moulding, fluid dynamics, polymers and joining technologies this would also be advantageous. You'll have skills in translating product requirements into design and development objectives and have good time management skills to ensure prioritisation and completion of key objectives to enable concurrent engineering.

Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.
